Text:
The [spec](http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/manual/spec.html#_Toc270597450) isn't explicit about it, but the only examples given are within sequence expressions. That, along with the fact that nothing else works, seems to confirm your conclusion.

FYI - Here are the relevant docs for the range operators.

[`Operators.( .. )<^T>`](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee370568.aspx)  
[`Operators.( .. .. )<^T,^Step>`](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee353647.aspx)

[Section 3.8.2](http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/manual/spec.html#_Toc270597393) also mentions special handling of `.. ..`, so it's safe to assume it's subject to limitations/behavior apart from those of typical functions/operators.

The [spec <sup>6.3.12</sup>](http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/manual/spec.html#_Toc270597450) isn't explicit about it, but the only examples given are within sequence expressions. That, along with the fact that nothing else works, seems to confirm your conclusion.

FYI - Here are the relevant docs for the range operators.

[`Operators.( .. )<^T>`](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee370568.aspx)  
[`Operators.( .. .. )<^T,^Step>`](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee353647.aspx)

[Section 3.8.2](http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/manual/spec.html#_Toc270597393) also mentions special handling of `.. ..`, so it's safe to assume it's subject to limitations/behavior apart from those of typical functions/operators.

The [spec <sup>ยง 6.3.12</sup>](http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/manual/spec.html#_Toc270597450) isn't explicit about it, but the only examples given are within sequence expressions. That, along with the fact that nothing else works, seems to confirm your conclusion.

FYI - Here are the relevant docs for the range operators.

[`Operators.( .. )<^T>`](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee370568.aspx)  
[`Operators.( .. .. )<^T,^Step>`](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee353647.aspx)

[Section 3.8.2](http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/fsharp/manual/spec.html#_Toc270597393) also mentions special handling of `(.. ..)`, so it's safe to assume it's subject to limitations/behavior apart from those of typical functions/operators.
